FuncDef:
The reflector command enables the session-reflector function and displays the session-reflector view.
The undo reflector command disables the session-reflector function.
By default, the session-reflector function is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Two-Way Active Measurement Protocol (TWAMP) uses the client/server mode and defines four logical entities, the server, client, session-sender, and session-reflector. Control signals are transmitted between the client and server, and probes are transmitted between the session-sender and session-reflector. After the session-reflector is configured, the session-reflector can reply to the session-sender with timestamps and serial numbers to help collect statistics about the delay, jitter, and packet loss rate.
Currently a Huawei device can function only as the session-reflector. To implement TWAMP, ensure that devices that can function as the session-sender exist on the network.
Precautions
The undo reflector command deletes all configurations of a session-reflector.
